messages.subject: Re: england-japan
messages.msgSnippet: I would look at pre-parliamentary England. The samurai never had any kind of democratic assembly, so drawing parallels would be difficult. Thomas
messages.messageBody:
I would look at pre-parliamentary England.

The samurai never had any kind of democratic assembly, so drawing
parallels would be difficult.

Thomas

messages.subject: england-japan
messages.msgSnippet: I don t know anything about the history of neither Japan nor England, but in this limited knowledge I still can figure some similarities between both. Would
messages.messageBody:
I don't know anything about the history of neither Japan nor England, but in this limited knowledge I still can figure some similarities between both. Would some answer my questions?

does shogunatte (is it correct?) have in common with parlementary in England? What about daimyo and land Lord? I still cannot figure out what the similar for samurai.

Maybe I too narrow simplify both huge history.

sincerly,

cat



---------------------------------

messages.subject: Re: Sono Toki.... Takeda Shingen
messages.msgSnippet: ... Does anyone know if this show is coming out in other countries? Or does anyone know where I can get my hands on these episodes.
messages.messageBody:
--- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, "Kitsuno" <samurai-
listowner@s...> wrote:
> For anyone in Japan, the next episode of "Sono Toki, Rekishi ga
> Ugoita" is on Takeda Shingen. It airs on 9/1 at 9:15PM.


Does anyone know if this show is coming out in other countries? Or
does anyone know where I can get my hands on these episodes.

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Re: Sono Toki.... Takeda Shingen
messages.msgSnippet: ... Missed it--too much else going on. Sounds interesting, though, and I ll catch the Nobunaga one next week. __________________________________ Do you Yahoo!?
messages.messageBody:
--- Kitsuno <samurai-listowner@...>
wrote:

> Anyone else catch this episode? It covered Takeda
> Shingen's
> infrastructure and financial works in Kai, rather
> than the battles.
> Actually pretty interesting. Next week, 9/8 at
> 9:15PM is on Oda
> Nobunaga - now that the olympics are over, it looks
> like they are
> moving back to the Sengoku era.

Missed it--too much else going on. Sounds interesting,
though, and I'll catch the Nobunaga one next week.

messages.subject: Re: Sono Toki.... Takeda Shingen
messages.msgSnippet: Anyone else catch this episode?  It covered Takeda Shingen s infrastructure and financial works in Kai, rather than the battles. Actually pretty interesting.
messages.messageBody:
Anyone else catch this episode? It covered Takeda Shingen's
infrastructure and financial works in Kai, rather than the battles.
Actually pretty interesting. Next week, 9/8 at 9:15PM is on Oda
Nobunaga - now that the olympics are over, it looks like they are
moving back to the Sengoku era.

messages.subject: Sono Toki.... Takeda Shingen
messages.msgSnippet: For anyone in Japan, the next episode of Sono Toki, Rekishi ga Ugoita is on Takeda Shingen.  It airs on 9/1 at 9:15PM.  I think it is on NHK.
messages.messageBody:
For anyone in Japan, the next episode of "Sono Toki, Rekishi ga
Ugoita" is on Takeda Shingen. It airs on 9/1 at 9:15PM. I think it
is on NHK.
